alert.note: Alert for Catoosa (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 24 at 8:22PM EST until February 25 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Tennessee... West Chickamauga Creek near Fort Oglethorpe affecting Hamilton and Catoosa Counties. For the North GA Chickamauga Creek Basin...including Fort Oglethorpe...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecasted to continue. * WHERE...West Chickamauga Creek near Fort Oglethorpe. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...Between 11 and 13 feet, Flood Stage is reached. Minor flooding begins of woodlands and fields near the creek upstream and downstream from the gage on the Georgia Highway 146 or Cloud Springs Road bridge. Minor flooding of the creek can also be expected further downstream as it crosses the Tennessee border into the south East Ridge area. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 PM EST Thursday the stage was 11.3 feet and steady. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:15 PM EST Thursday was 11.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight and continue falling to 5.3 feet Tuesday evening. - Flood stage is 11 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 11.0 feet on 12/24/2019. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
